dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A southern cyclone is heading for Kazakhstan, bringing a whole mix of severe weather.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A southern cyclone is heading for Kazakhstan, bringing a whole mix of severe weather.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A southern cyclone is expected to bring heavy rains, thunderstorms and dust storms to Kazakhstan in the coming days.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's hitting from May 6th to the 8th, starting in the western and northern parts with heavy rain and even some hail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's hitting from May sixth to the eighth, starting in the western and northern parts with heavy rain and even some hail.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: From May 6 to 8, western, northwestern and northern regions of the country will experience showers, thunderstorms and, in some areas, hail.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and then it shifts to central and eastern areas after that. I mean, West Kazakhstan and Atyrau are supposed to see heavy rainfall on the 6th and 7th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and then it shifts to central and eastern areas after that. I mean, West Kazakhstan and Atyrau are supposed to see heavy rainfall on the sixth and seventh.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting May 8, the weather system will shift to the central, eastern and southern parts of Kazakhstan. Heavy rainfall is forecast for May 6-7 in West Kazakhstan and Atyrau regions, on May 7 in Mangistau region, and May 7-8 in Aktobe region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Mangistau gets it on the 7th, while Aktobe has it through the 7th and 8th. That's a lot of rain in a short span.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Mangistau gets it on the seventh, while Aktobe has it through the seventh and eighth. That's a lot of rain in a short span.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Heavy rainfall is forecast for May 6-7 in West Kazakhstan and Atyrau regions, on May 7 in Mangistau region, and May 7-8 in Aktobe region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. But Karaganda region is staying completely dry, which is kind of surprising given how widespread this system is.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. But Karaganda region is staying completely dry, which is kind of surprising given how widespread this system is.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Only Karaganda region is expected to remain dry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but then you've got dust storms in the southwest, and on the 8th in the southeast too. That's gonna be rough for visibility and air quality.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but then you've got dust storms in the southwest, and on the eighth in the southeast too. That's gonna be rough for visibility and air quality.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dust storms are expected in the southwest and on May 8 in the southeast.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And don't forget the frost—Pavlodar and Abai might see frost overnight on the 6th, and East Kazakhstan on the 6th and 7th. Frost in May?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And don't forget the frost-Pavlodar and Abai might see frost overnight on the sixth, and East Kazakhstan on the sixth and seventh. Frost in May?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Frosts are possible in the nighttime and early morning hours of May 6 in Pavlodar and Abai regions, as well as on May 6-7 in East Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? That's pretty unusual. Meanwhile, daytime temps are all over the place—the west is cooling down a bit from like 30 to 26 degrees.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? That's pretty unusual. Meanwhile, daytime temps are all over the place-the west is cooling down a bit from like thirty to twenty six degrees.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Daytime temperatures will fluctuate: in the west, highs will drop from 23-30ÂC to 21-26ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But the northwest, north, and east are actually warming up, going up to 24-29 degrees. And then the south and southeast are just baking—up to 38 degrees!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the northwest, north, and east are actually warming up, going up to twenty four to twenty nine degrees. And then the south and southeast are just baking-up to thirty eight degrees!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the northwest, north and east, temperatures will rise from 20-25ÂC to 24-29ÂC. Central regions can expect up to 27-35ÂC, while the south and southeast will see extreme heat reaching up to 38ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Extreme heat in the south while other parts are dealing with frost and storms. What a wild swing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Extreme heat in the south while other parts are dealing with frost and storms. What a wild swing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely a reminder of how variable spring weather can be, especially with these cyclones moving through.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely a reminder of how variable spring weather can be, especially with these cyclones moving through.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. People should really stay updated on local forecasts this week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. People should really stay updated on local forecasts this week.
